document_data.name: The Flaming Griffon
document_data.mainbody: The '''Flaming Griffon''' was an inn in the city of [[Mordulkin]] in [[Chessenta]] in the early 1370s [[DR]]. Its proprietor was [[Rueldarr]].
document_data.Description:
The inn stood two stories high, and had glass-paned windows and a black door. Its sign depicted a [[griffon]] (with the body of a [[lion]] and the head of an [[eagle]]) with wings of fire.

The inn offered adjoining rooms, and rooms held two single beds, a writing desk, and armoire. There was also a common room for patrons.
document_data.Services:
In addition to rooms, the inn provided baths and meals, which included roast mutton, stewed vegetables, and bread, and five-bean soup.

The staff were helpful and accommodating.
document_data.History: In the winter of the [[1374 DR|Year of Lightning Storms, 1374 DR]], [[Ythnel Duumin]], [[Kestus Aentius]], [[Muctos Dapritus]] and [[Kohtakah]]—surviving members of the [[Mage Society]] of [[Luthcheq]]—escaped to Mordulkin and stayed at the Flaming Griffon.
